sentences.english: The company awarded the employees prizes for full attendance in one month.
sentences.chinese: 這個公司頒發全勤獎給一個月都沒請假的員工。

sentences.english: Now, today's shift will be the eighth straight full-deployment shift in DC.
sentences.chinese: 現在，今天的值班將是特區連續第八天的全勤值班。

sentences.english: Last semester in school I was working two jobs and going to school full time.
sentences.chinese: 上學期，我在學校裏打兩份工並上課全勤。

sentences.english: He has not missed a game the past two seasons.
sentences.chinese: 在過去的兩個賽季中，他都保持全勤。

sentences.english: He was praised for regularity of attendance.
sentences.chinese: 他因爲全勤獲得了表揚。

sentences.english: Comrade Wang has never missed a day's work for years.
sentences.chinese: 王同志這幾年一直是全勤。

sentences.english: Mr. Wang has never missed a day's work for years.
sentences.chinese: 王先生這幾年一直是全勤。

sentences.english: She will have attended all the classes if she shows up today.
sentences.chinese: 如果她今天出席的話，她就會全勤。

definition: to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
to be absent from work or school
to return to one's unit/to go back to one's station in life
to replace (a damaged component with a new one, an injured player with a substitute player, full-time workers with casual workers etc)/a substitute/a replacement
total victory/to excel by far/name of a tank/slam
initial/arising first/same as 首先發起|首先发起
to take a vacation/to go on holiday
(of a performer) to come onto the stage to perform/(of an athlete) to enter the arena to compete/(fig.) to enter the scene (e.g. a new product)/(of an examinee etc) to leave the venue
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
